quest.name: Heart of Darkness
journal: Thancred is looking particularly chipper, despite the heavy rainfall.

Thancred is as pleased as anyone by the return of rain to the Empty. However, being the practically minded fellow he is, he suggests choosing another location to discuss your next move, as having waterlogged smallclothes is making it rather difficult to concentrate.

Urianger's explanation of the plan to restore the ice element is soon interrupted by Gaia, who is none too pleased to hear that it may take decades for the Empty to be restored. Upon hearing that the endeavor is for the benefit of future generations, Gaia, clearly moved by your selfless deeds, finally begins to open up, expressing her innermost doubts and fears. Her thoughts are soon interrupted by what appears to be a sudden headache, and she absents herself, heading outside for some fresh air. The others express their growing concern for her well-being, and Thancred suggests that you go to check on her. You arrive on Eden's canopy to find Gaia lost in a reverie, and the situation takes a dramatic turn for the worse when a dark aura manifests around her and coalesces into an ominous floating glyph. At that moment, countless flying sin eaters appear from nowhere and begin circling above Eden, with the glyph at their center, though rather than attacking this dark entity, they seem to be in its thrall. With Gaia now rendered immobile and entirely defenseless, you have no choice but to take her to Eden's core and decide how best to approach this unforeseen threat.

With Gaia now unconscious, Thancred recommends dealing with the sin eaters swarming around Eden before attempting to make sense of their sudden arrival. He volunteers to stay in the core to repel any attackers that breach Eden's defenses, while Urianger tends to Gaia. You prepare to confront the mysterious embodiment of Darkness and its legion of enslaved sin eaters.

※Eden's Verse: Iconoclasm can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Despite being impossibly outnumbered, you succeed in dispersing the dark aether and the horde of sin eaters that were drawn to it. With the threat now apparently eliminated, you return to Eden's core to see if Gaia's condition has changed for the better.

You return to find that Gaia is still in a comatose state, with Ryne desperately pleading for her to wake up. Her voice seems to reach Gaia, who eventually regains consciousness. Naturally, she is more than a little subdued, though you and your companions are glad to see that she is otherwise unharmed. With the worst now behind you, it seems to be safe to proceed with the plan to restore the element of ice.
objectives: Speak with Urianger in Eden's core.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Poor Gaia... If the faerie lives inside her, why would it let her suffer like this? I wish there was something we could do to help...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pray be on thy guard, my friend. Gaia may yet relinquish control to the voice within...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Ungh... Just get it over with, would you?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While this downpour is precisely the result we were hoping for, the novelty of standing outside in the rain does wear off rather quickly. Not to mention, Gaia's looking a bit under the weather. Let's continue this conversation in Eden's core.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Now that I think about it, I don't really know all that much about Eden.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Since we need to find out how it's connected to Gaia, I should try to understand it at a deeper level. To be honest, there isn't much else I can do...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'm not sure what's going on with Gaia, but it's certainly a cause for concern. Perhaps this is the faerie making itself known...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What does it want? Why won't it tell me?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ere we set forth to restore the element of ice, I would discuss the manner in which the summoning shall be undertaken.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Just tell me one thing: is this going to bring the Empty back to the way it was before the Flood?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: While none can say for certain, the change we have observed at points of aetherial intersection doth give us cause for optimism.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: It may be reasonably assumed that the Empty shall continue to transform and, in the decades to come, regain a semblance of its former state.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Decades!?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I don't think you've quite grasped the sheer scale of the damage left in the wake of the Flood. It would've swallowed the entire world if Minfilia hadn't stopped it.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Even if Ryne has inherited her blessing, wounds like that don't heal overnight. After all, the Empty has been utterly devoid of life for a hundred years.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: And it might take even longer than that to bring life back. I don't expect immediate results, but I do know that it will stay like this forever unless we do something about it.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: My sentiments precisely. Only once the final element is restored shall we have a glimpse of the future that awaiteth those of generations yet to come.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: You'd do all this, for a world you may not live long enough to see? While here I am, so absorbed in my own problems that I spare barely a thought for anyone besides myself...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: For so long, I've listened to that voice...telling me what to do, who to be. I was so scared of what might happen if I disobeyed. But I don't want to live like that anymore. I want to be...me.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Who am I? What am I? Perhaps it's better if I never find out. If Ryne's the Oracle of Light, here to mend this broken world, what does that make me?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Gaia, the Oracle of Darkness, bringer of misery and death! A monster. It's no wonder they left me. Mother, Father... And next, it'll be all of you. Then I'll be back where I started, where I've always been. Alone.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Gaia! Is it the faerie!?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What's wrong? Afraid I might lose control and ruin all your carefully laid plans!?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: No! It's you I'm worried about!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Ryne, I... I'm going outside. To clear my head. You...just do what you need to do, all right?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Something's wrong, I know it.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That much is clear.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: If we have a repeat of her first “visit” to Eden, we may even be joined by those voidsent friends of hers... If you go and see what Gaia's doing, Urianger and I will stay with Ryne.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: My name is Gaia... That's what you said, isn't it?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Eden... The Flood... What does it all mean?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: No, it can't be... Is this what it's been waiting for all this time?

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: Finally, you remember...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Aaaaaah!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What...is this!?

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: The Darkness that dwells within you, Gaia.

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text:
The accursed spawn of Light are drawn to it, like moths to a flame.
Pathetic, mindless, and easily bent to my will...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Sin eaters!?

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: Now, the time of awakening has come!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Unnnh...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Forename, Ryne senses sin eaters! What's happened?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Don't try to fight them─just bring Gaia back inside. Quickly, now!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: She's in a bad way, but at least she doesn't seem to have lost control.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: What entity is this that should hold a horde of sin eaters in its thrall? And to what end?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: She is unconscious.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: What's happened to her?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That's a concern for later. First, we must deal with those sin eaters.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Forename, if thou wouldst care to repel our assailants without, I would task Thancred with standing guard within. I shall tend to Gaia meanwhile.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm not sure if there's much Eden can do to help, but I'll try to keep it steady.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While Urianger watches over Gaia, I'll tend to any eaters that chance to slip inside.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Whereas before, 'twas Gaia who sought to destroy Eden, on this occasion she hath become the target...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The interior is secure. With the eaters gone, I thought that Gaia might show some sign of improvement, but she hasn't so much as stirred.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Sin eaters drawn to the Oracle of Darkness, just as she herself was drawn to Eden, first and foremost among their kind.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: She won't wake up! What do we do?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What is this place?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Where is everyone?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: So, I'm all alone. Even the faerie is gone...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Endless silence, endless darkness... Is this what death feels like?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: It's no use. No one can hear me. How ironic... All those times I wanted peace and quiet, and now that I finally have it, I wish I had someone to talk to.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I thought I couldn't stand to be around them. All their interfering and fussing... And yet, I was never lonely.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: But it's no use... Even after everything we went through, my memories still won't come back. There is no future awaiting me, only emptiness.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Those memories...they can stay lost forever, if only this pain will leave me.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Now, I close my eyes and sink into darkness...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: And then I'll suffer no more.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Mother, Father...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Wake up!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I understand now. Why wait for tomorrow to claim us?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Gaia! Can you hear me!?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: This perfect moment never has to end.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: (-???-)I'm not giving up on you, Gaia! Say something!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What do you want?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Please! I'm begging you!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Remember all the things we said we'd do? Like going to the Second Serving for coffee biscuits!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I never...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Gaia?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I never agreed to anything of the sort.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh, thank goodness! I was so worried about you!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Ugh, do you have to be so loud?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: The faerie fell silent, only to be replaced by Ryne's voice ringing through my head.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I never thought I would be so glad to hear it.
